item.title: Valve Restricts Accounts of 2500 Users Who Marked a Negative Game Review Useful
item.description: Valve has restricted the accounts of 2500 users who marked a negative review for Warlander useful, leading to a 30-day ban on up- and downvoting for those affected.

item.title: Why does a plastic-wrapped turkey sandwich cost $15 at the NYC airport?
Lofi air traffic control â€“ LAX
item.description: The post shares the frequency of the Los Angeles Tower (North) at KLAX, which is 133.900.

item.title: What are transformer models & how do they work?
item.description: Transformer models are a new development in machine learning and are adept at generating coherent text by tracking context.

item.title: WebGPU Fundamentals
item.description: This post provides a set of articles for learning the fundamentals of WebGPU, including data memory layout, 3D math, and WebGPU from WebGL.

item.title: Google CEO: "can we change the setting of this group to history-off" [pdf]
item.description: Hacker News is discussing WebGPU Fundamentals, the successor to WebGL, for its potential in client-side deep learning and browser simulations.

item.title: Surviving Burnout (2015)
item.description: Burnout in the tech industry is caused by a misalignment of responsibility, authority, and resources.

item.title: Low Code Software Development Is a Lie
item.description: An experienced software developer argues that creating software is difficult due to clients and developers not understanding the root causes of problems they want to solve, rather than the fault of coding languages and tools.

item.title: Remote code execution vulnerability in Google they are not willing to fix
item.description: A security researcher found a vulnerability in Google that allowed them to run arbitrary code on the computers of over 50 Google employees, caused by dependency confusion in Python's management system.

item.title: Hypervisor Development in Rust
item.description: This article describes the development of a Rust-based research hypervisor for Intel VT-x virtualization, providing Rust code examples for VMX operation and discussing the process of initializing memory regions for virtual CPUs.
